name: Naltrexone-Bupropion (Contrave)
summary: A combination medication used for chronic weight management in adults with obesity or overweight with weight-related comorbidities.
description: Naltrexone-bupropion is an extended-release combination of an opioid antagonist (naltrexone) and a norepinephrine-dopamine reuptake inhibitor (bupropion). It is used as an adjunct to a reduced-calorie diet and increased physical activity for chronic weight management. The combination targets both appetite regulation and reward pathways involved in eating behavior.

contraindications: Chronic opioid use or acute opioid withdrawal

synonyms: naltrexone hydrochloride and bupropion hydrochloride ER

items: Chronic weight management in adults with BMI ≥30 kg/m²
Chronic weight management in adults with BMI ≥27 kg/m² with at least one weight-related condition (e.g., hypertension, type 2 diabetes, dyslipidemia)

sections.text: Bupropion enhances activity of norepinephrine and dopamine, reducing appetite and cravings; naltrexone blocks opioid receptors, modulating reward pathways involved in eating.

adult.titration: Week 1: 1 tablet AM; Week 2: 1 tablet AM, 1 tablet PM; Week 3: 2 tablets AM, 1 tablet PM; Week 4 and onward: 2 tablets AM, 2 tablets PM
adult.tablet_strength: 8 mg naltrexone / 90 mg bupropion per tablet

sections.hepatic_impairment: Moderate: 1 tablet AM and 1 tablet PM; Severe: Not recommended
sections.renal_impairment: Moderate to severe: Max 1 tablet AM and 1 tablet PM

items: Extended-release tablets: 8 mg naltrexone / 90 mg bupropion

sections.text: Weight loss effects may be observed within 4–8 weeks; evaluate efficacy at 12 weeks.

sections.black_box: Bupropion component may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts and behaviors in children, adolescents, and young adults.
other: Risk of seizure increases with higher doses
Can cause elevated blood pressure and heart rate

items: Blood pressure and heart rate at baseline and periodically

sections.geriatrics: Monitor for hypertension and neuropsychiatric effects

items: Discontinue if <5% weight loss after 12 weeks at maintenance dose
Encourage concurrent lifestyle modifications for best results
Not for use in opioid-dependent patients
